markdownRemark.html:
Product design sprint

Problem statement
Comedy goers don't have the cohesive solution to search and follow stand up comedians.
Sprint questions
  1. Is online stand-up comedian directory useful to comedy goers?
  2. Is an online venue directory useful to comedy goers?
MVP goal
  1. Build an online stand-up comedian directory
  2. Build associated features such as searching, following, and filtering

Branding

  • Collect visual inspiration (Fig.2)
  • Build brand identity (Fig.3)

Visual narrative

Conceptualize
  • Visualize the concept and materialize it into a scene.
  • Expand the concept with an associated definition.
Commonize
  • Scope out expanded terms and narrow down to the core concept.
  • Research pronoun with consensus in common communication.
Visualize
  • Add custom touch that matches with branding tone.

Define user flow

  • Flow by touch points and context - events / comedians / venues
  • Flow by user status - guest user vs. account user

Define JTBD + draft solution

  1. When I search for a comedy event that I want to go,
  2. I want to search by comedians I like,
  3. So I can be confident to choose the show that I would enjoy.

Diverge iOS MVP ideas

Option A
Comedy event calendar (Fig.22) Date > shows > comedians
Option B
Comedian directory (Fig.23) Comedians > shows + date > venues

No/low code MVP solution

  • Using option B(Fig.23) with following comedian feature, bookmarking show feature
  • Using Adalo to build iOS native application
Open interactive prototype

Contribution

Product strategy
  • Participate product sprint process to validate the business concept
  • Refine the priority list with scoping workshop
UI / Visual design
  • Build visual storytelling with illustration
  • Creating an interactive prototype using Sketch and UXPin
  • Build app UI and BD using Adalo no-code tool
UX design
  • Conduct switch interview with comedians and comedy goers to define JTBD stories
  • Conduct user testing to validate the MVP concept
Front-end
  • Ruby on rail application front-end
  • ERB / SCSS / JS

frontmatter.title: Comedy portal MVP
frontmatter.excerpt: Refine the product strategy to build a valid MVP version of the web app and native app along with the marketing landing pages.
